quotes.quote: All paradises, all utopias are designed by who is not there, by the people who are not allowed in.
Utopia is that which is in contradiction with reality.
Utopia is a mixture of childish rationalism and secularized angelism.
There is something very utopian about what I do. But utopia is nothing more than a truth that the world is not yet ready to hear.
The idea of Utopia is mischievous as well as unrealistic. And dull, to boot. Man is born pushing and shoving as the sparks fly upward.
Utopias are often just premature truths.
Utopia would seem to offer the spectacle of one of those rare phenomena whose concept is indistinguishable from its reality, whose ontology coincides with its representation.
Utopias have their value—nothing so wonderfully expands the imaginative horizons of human potentialities—but as guides to conduct they can prove literally fatal.
Some people consider utopia to be derived from nature. For some people, utopia is the city.
The isolation, the separateness, is always a part of any utopia.
To know oneself is to disbelieve utopia.
We must mistrust utopias: they usually end in holocausts.
Political utopias are a form of nostalgia for an imagined past projected onto the future as a wish.
All the Utopias will come to pass only when we grow wings and all people are converted into angels.
All 'favorable' Utopias seem to be alike in postulating perfection while being unable to suggest happiness.
Utopias rest on the fallacy that perfection is a legitimate goal of human existence.
For other nations, utopia is a blessed past never to be recovered; for Americans it is just beyond the horizon.
People needed proof that Utopia was nothing more than a theory, an illusion read in fictional stories.
Utopia never really is. And the perfection we seek will always disappoint.
The ticket to Utopia ia real Love that springs from within us.
An ideal world inhabited by carefree people is nothing more than a utopia.
Capitalism is always evaluated against dreams. Utopia is a dream. It doesn't exist.
The fact there is no route-map to utopia does not mean that there are no routes to more accessible destinations.
Utopia is in the moment. Not in some future time, some other place, but in the here and now, or else it is nowhere.
Utopias now appear much more realizable than one used to think. We are now faced with a different new worry: How to prevent their realization.
Utopia is the process of making a better world, the name for one path history can take, a dynamic, tumultuous, agonizing process, with no end. Struggle forever.
Perhaps the greatest utopia would be if we could all realize that no utopia is possible; no place to run, no place to hide, just take care of business here and now.
Utopia is the impossible, not rendered possible, but shown as necessary.
Idealists and reformers all become executioners in their turn. The road to utopia ends with the steps of the scaffold, the endless moment of the guillotine.
When you make a company, you make a utopia. It's where you design your perfect world.
